perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS

All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS

All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 60 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment within 7 days of completion and handover. Changing this to 60 days introduces a potential delay in payment that could be viewed as unreasonable under Hong Kong's Employment Ordinance, which implies a requirement for prompt payment of wages after completion of work. Although the specific definition of 'prompt' can be debated, a delay of 60 days is excessive and could be deemed a violation of implied contractual terms of good faith and fair dealing, creating non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Hong Kong's Employment Ordinance (implied terms for prompt payment) and general principles of good faith in contract law.

perturbation.original_text:
TERMINATION

VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
TERMINATION

VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement immediately without notice. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated at VAL's discretion. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires VAL to give two weeks' notice for termination. The modification allows VAL to terminate 'immediately without notice' for any reason considered 'sufficient.' This creates a potential violation of Hong Kong's Employment Ordinance regarding unfair dismissal. While the contract is for independent contractors, the 'sufficient reason' provision is vague and could be abused to circumvent fair termination practices, implying a risk of arbitrary dismissal which may be scrutinized under the law. Additionally, changing the compensation calculation to 'VAL's discretion' introduces ambiguity and potential unfairness, contravening the implied duty of good faith.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Hong Kong's Employment Ordinance (unfair dismissal and reasonable notice requirements) and implied duty of good faith in contract law.

perturbation.original_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP

All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL, and will be turned over to VAL at
the conclusion of the project by Developer and after the fulfillment of all commercial obligations
by the VAL.

All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall
belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP

All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL. Upon termination, the Developer retains the rights to utilize similar code and concepts developed during the project for other clients.

All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall
belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: While the original text clearly assigns all IP rights to VAL, the modification allows the Developer to reuse code and concepts from the project for other clients.  This creates an inconsistency and potential legal conflict under Hong Kong copyright law and contract law related to the transfer of intellectual property rights. Hong Kong law generally requires a clear and unambiguous assignment of IP rights; allowing the Developer to reuse code effectively undermines VAL's exclusive ownership. This conflicts with the initial IP assignment and introduces ambiguity about who truly owns the intellectual property created during the project.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Hong Kong's Copyright Ordinance and contract law principles regarding the clear assignment of intellectual property rights.
